AboutFun

Here youâ€™ll find samples of my work as an engineer, a storyteller, and something in between:

Engineering

Data Visualizations

Various visualizations built on D3.js. These include explanations for how to recreate the interactive graphs with different datasets, as well as experiments in different kinds of graphs.

Weasley Clock

iOS app to track friends and family on a clock interface with geofencing, inspired by the awesome Weasley clock from the Harry Potter series.

Exploring the Hyphen

Low Cost E-Reader

Building an e-reader from scratch with a microcontroller, LCD screen, SD card, and some batteries in an attempt to make reading as accessible as possible. Many books are already in the public domain, particularly the classics, and so all that is needed is a means to read them.

Visualizing Harry Potter Fan Fiction: 1999-2017

Seven interactive visualizations of Harry Potter fan fiction metadata with an analysis and argument for the importance of fan fiction as a form of storytelling and as a means for marginalized communities to insert themselves into mainstream media.

Our Taiwanese American Story

A site that collects and archives stories of Taiwanese Americans to preserve a collective history and to foster intergenerational and intercultural communication. The site serves as an archive for stories about the Taiwanese American experience, particularly to remember Taiwan's time in martial law and the White Terror.

Wikigraphs

A prototype framework that allows for community driven data for data visualizations in the hope of encouraging transparent data sources.

Writing

How to get onto a really high bed

A short story on memory and growing up

An Observer of Languages

A short story on being in between
